main event: On November 6, 1954, at Edwards Air Force Base, California, multiple unidentified aerial objects were observed, with some reports indicating the sighting of bright, round, silver-colored objects at high altitudes and high speeds, exhibiting advanced maneuvering capabilities. These objects were observed for several minutes before disappearing from view.
interesting points: The objects were observed by reliable witnesses, including civilian employees, military personnel, and control tower operators.

Some reports described the objects as bright, white, circular in shape, and pulsating or flashing at a rapid rate, while others indicated the objects' silver color and round shape, with no visible means of propulsion.
The behavior of the objects, including sharp turns and sudden accelerations, was noted to be far beyond the capabilities of known conventional aircraft at that time.
Despite investigations and observations, the identity of the objects could not be determined, and they were ultimately categorized as Unidentified Aerial Objects.
Reports also mentioned the absence of noise, exhaust, or trails associated with the objects, further adding to their mysterious nature.
witnesses: reliable witnesses including civilian employees, military personnel, and control tower operators
photographs: multiple reports mentioned photographs were taken but determination of object identity could not be made from the available information
